headline: Clorox’s 5% Yield Dominates Consumer Staples: Can It Continue?
summary: The Clorox Company just paid investors $1.24 per share on February 13, 2026, marking the latest payment in a 48-year streak of consecutive dividend increases. But the Dividend King’s crown sits uneasily on a company navigating operational turbulence and margin pressure that raises questions about whether this 4.07% yield compensates investors for the risks ahead. ... Clorox’s 5% Yield Dominates Consumer Staples: Can It Continue?

headline: Colgate-Palmolive Dividend Scorecard: How Does the 2.6% Yield Stack Up?
summary: Colgate-Palmolive just sent $0.52 per share to investors that will land on February 13, 2026, marking another quarterly payment in the consumer goods giant’s 63-year dividend increase streak. That consistency places Colgate among an elite group of Dividend Aristocrats, but the real question for income investors is whether this 2.19% yield justifies the premium valuation—and ... Colgate-Palmolive Dividend Scorecard: How Does the 2.6% Yield Stack Up?

headline: Procter & Gamble Shares Jump 10% in a Month: Time to Buy or Wait?
summary: PG delivers modest sales growth in Q2 but faces margin pressure, tariff headwinds and soft EPS outlook, as premium valuation tests upside potential.

headline: Kimberly-Clark: Bigger Is Not Likely The Answer

headline: P&G Rallies Under New CEO but Lags Rivals, Faces Tariff Challenges
summary: Procter & Gamble (NYSE: PG) stock has climbed 11.65% year-to-date as of February 11, 2026, reaching $160 per share from a year-end close of $142.31. That gain looks impressive until you examine the broader consumer staples landscape. Clorox (NYSE: CLX) has surged 24.91%, Colgate-Palmolive (NYSE: CL) jumped 20.62%, and Church & Dwight (NYSE: CHD) gained ... P&G Rallies Under New CEO but Lags Rivals, Faces Tariff Challenges

headline: What's Going On With Neutrogena Maker Kenvue Stock On Thursday?
summary: Kenvue investors approve its sale to Kimberly-Clark. Stock nears 52-week lows ahead of February earnings, with mixed technical signals and cautious analyst ratings.

headline: Kimberly-Clark Corporation (KMB) Receives Boost on Kenvue Acquisition Push as Evercore ISI Warns of Competition Pressure
summary: Kimberly-Clark Corporation (NASDAQ:KMB) is one of the best long-term retirement stocks. On January 29, shareholders approved the proposed acquisition of Kenvue by Kimberly-Clark Corporation (NASDAQ:KMB). The voting results indicate that 96% of Kimberly-Clark Corp approved the issuance of shares in connection with the proposed acquisition. The proposed merger is poised to result in a combined […]
